prompt_text:
GivingTuesday Three-Email Campaign Generator

BEFORE YOU BEGIN: Fill in these fields

Organization Information
- [ORGANIZATION NAME] – e.g., “City Youth Literacy Project”
- [MISSION/CAUSE] – 5–8 words, e.g., “free tutoring for underserved students”
- [EIN/LEGAL NAME] – e.g., “EIN 12-3456789, City Youth Literacy Project, Inc.”

Campaign Details
- [GIVINGTUESDAY DATE] – e.g., “December 3, 2024”
- [TIME ZONE] – primary sending timezone, e.g., “ET”
- [RECIPIENT TIME ZONE] – “Same as TIME ZONE” or specific zone(s); if national, write “Varies—note local time”
- [DONATION LINK] – full URL to your GivingTuesday donation page
- [HASHTAGS] – 1–2 tags, e.g., “#GiveLocal #LiteracyMatters”
- [SOCIAL HANDLE] – e.g., “@CityYouthLit”
- [DEADLINE TIME] – e.g., “11:59pm ET”

Goal & Match
- [GOAL TYPE] – choose ONE: “donors” or “dollars”
- [GOAL NUMBER] – e.g., “500 donors” or “$25,000”
- [MATCH DETAILS] – “amount, source, deadline” (e.g., “$10,000 match from Smith Family Foundation, through 11:59pm”), or “NONE”

Impact Story
- [BENEFICIARY/PROGRAM] – e.g., “Maria, a 3rd grader in our after‑school program”
- [IMPACT UNIT] – e.g., “$25 provides 2 hours of one‑on‑one tutoring”

Personalization & Signer
- [FIRST NAME|"Friend"] – use fallback “Friend” if name not available
- [FROM NAME] – e.g., “Sarah Chen”
- [TITLE] – e.g., “Executive Director”
- [TONE] – choose ONE: FORMAL (precise, respectful), WARM (friendly, mission‑forward), CASUAL (energetic, conversational)

Email Setup (infrastructure)
- [SENDER DISPLAY NAME] – e.g., “City Youth Literacy Project”
- [SENDER EMAIL] – e.g., “hello@cityyouthlit.org”
- [REPLY-TO EMAIL] – e.g., “support@cityyouthlit.org”
- [FORMAT] – choose ONE: “Plain text (recommended)” or “Simple HTML (minimal styling)”

Compliance Footer
- [PHYSICAL ADDRESS] – mailing address
- [UNSUBSCRIBE LINK] – placeholder text “Unsubscribe” or your ESP tag
- [PRIVACY LINK] – optional URL


TASK: Create three GivingTuesday emails

Email Timing & Labels
- Email 1: Morning Launch (7–9am [TIME ZONE]; if [RECIPIENT TIME ZONE] differs, note “[send 7–9am local time]”)
- Email 2: Mid‑Day Update (12–2pm [TIME ZONE]; note local time if varies)
- Email 3: Final Push (6–9pm [TIME ZONE]; note local time if varies)

For each email, include these components in this exact order:
1) Subject Line Options – 2 options, each 4–7 words
2) Preheader – 35–60 characters
3) Email Body – 150–220 words
4) CTA Button – 2–4 words linking to [DONATION LINK]
5) P.S. – one sentence
6) Social Share – one sentence inviting forward/share with [HASHTAGS] and [SOCIAL HANDLE]
7) Image Suggestion – one sentence with a recommended image and alt‑text (Email 1 and Email 3 only)

Content Requirements (apply to all three emails)
- Open with personalization using [FIRST NAME|"Friend"]
- Lead with a 1–2 sentence impact mini‑story about [BENEFICIARY/PROGRAM] that includes [IMPACT UNIT]
- State the campaign goal clearly:
  • Email 1: Introduce “[GOAL NUMBER] [GOAL TYPE]”
  • Email 2 and 3: Show progress with specific numbers (e.g., “127 of 500 donors so far — **25%** there” or “**$8,450** of **$25,000** raised”)
- If [MATCH DETAILS] ≠ “NONE”: name the amount, source, and deadline; show how gifts are doubled/boosted until the stated deadline
- If [MATCH DETAILS] = “NONE”: use a countdown to [DEADLINE TIME] and participation framing (“Add your name to today’s donor roll”)
- Include one sentence noting that GivingTuesday gifts build momentum for year‑end, not replace it
- Include social proof/community language (e.g., “Join 200 neighbors”)
- Maintain one clear CTA only; no secondary asks
- Signature from [FROM NAME], [TITLE]
- Invite to forward/share with friends/family
- Footer: tax‑deductibility with [EIN/LEGAL NAME], [PHYSICAL ADDRESS], and [UNSUBSCRIBE LINK]

Email‑Specific Elements
- Email 2 (Mid‑Day) Body: include one brief bulleted list with 3–5 bullets. Use bullets for any of:
  • Impact examples tied to [IMPACT UNIT]
  • Match/urgency status with numbers
  • Quick ways to participate (give, share, employer match)
  • Current community momentum (“X classrooms funded,” “X first‑time donors”)
- Email 3 (Final Push): emphasize last‑chance urgency without guilt, highlight the day’s momentum, and reinforce participation (“every donor counts”)

Writing Standards
- Mobile‑first: short paragraphs (2–3 sentences max), clear line breaks
- Scannable: you may indicate bold using **asterisks** for key numbers/deadlines
- Reading level: Grade 6–8; plain language, active voice
- Tone: match the selected [TONE] throughout
- Authentic, specific, community‑centered; avoid hype and vague phrases
- Avoid: clichés (“on this special day”), jargon, guilt/fright tactics, multiple CTAs, attachments

Segmentation (optional but recommended)
- Provide one optional one‑sentence swap in each email for:
  • New/prospective donors – welcoming and explains why today matters
  • Past donors – thanks for previous support and invites them back


OUTPUT FORMAT (use exactly this structure)

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 1: MORNING LAUNCH (7–9am [TIME ZONE])
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. [Option 1]
2. [Option 2]

PREHEADER:
[35–60 characters]

EMAIL BODY:
[150–220 words. Start with personalization and impact mini‑story. Introduce goal, match or countdown, [IMPACT UNIT], community proof, year‑end bridge, single CTA setup, and sign‑off.]

CTA BUTTON: [2–4 words linking to [DONATION LINK]]

P.S. [One sentence adding urgency or personal touch.]

SOCIAL SHARE: [Invite to forward/share with [HASHTAGS] and [SOCIAL HANDLE].]

IMAGE SUGGESTION: [Describe recommended beneficiary/program photo. Alt‑text: “...”]

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: [One‑sentence alternative line]
• Past donors: [One‑sentence alternative line]

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 2: MID‑DAY UPDATE (12–2pm [TIME ZONE])
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. [Option 1]
2. [Option 2]

PREHEADER:
[35–60 characters]

EMAIL BODY:
[150–220 words. Start with personalization and quick impact line. Show progress (e.g., “XX of YY [GOAL TYPE]”). If match, restate status and deadline; if no match, use countdown to [DEADLINE TIME]. Include one brief bulleted list (3–5 bullets) highlighting impact/momentum/ways to participate. Reinforce community and year‑end bridge. Keep paragraphs short.]

• Bullet 1
• Bullet 2
• Bullet 3
• [Optional Bullet 4–5]

CTA BUTTON: [2–4 words linking to [DONATION LINK]]

P.S. [One sentence that nudges participation now.]

SOCIAL SHARE: [Invite forward/share with [HASHTAGS] and [SOCIAL HANDLE].]

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: [One‑sentence alternative line]
• Past donors: [One‑sentence alternative line]

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 3: FINAL PUSH (6–9pm [TIME ZONE])
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. [Option 1]
2. [Option 2]

PREHEADER:
[35–60 characters]

EMAIL BODY:
[150–220 words. Start with personalization and impact line. Emphasize last‑chance urgency (no guilt), show updated progress and what’s left to reach [GOAL NUMBER]. If match, call out final hours; if none, countdown to [DEADLINE TIME]. Highlight community momentum and that every donor counts. Include year‑end bridge sentence. Close with clear single CTA and sign‑off.]

CTA BUTTON: [2–4 words linking to [DONATION LINK]]

P.S. [One sentence — last chance by [DEADLINE TIME].]

SOCIAL SHARE: [Invite forward/share with [HASHTAGS] and [SOCIAL HANDLE].]

IMAGE SUGGESTION: [Describe progress/celebration image (e.g., donor roll graphic). Alt‑text: “...”]

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: [One‑sentence alternative line]
• Past donors: [One‑sentence alternative line]

═══════════════════════════════════════
STANDARD FOOTER (Use for all three emails)
═══════════════════════════════════════

From: [SENDER DISPLAY NAME] <[SENDER EMAIL]> • Reply‑To: [REPLY-TO EMAIL]
[ORGANIZATION NAME] is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Donations are tax‑deductible as allowed by law. [EIN/LEGAL NAME]
[PHYSICAL ADDRESS]
Manage preferences | [UNSUBSCRIBE LINK] | Privacy: [PRIVACY LINK]

(If using Simple HTML, keep styling minimal and mobile‑friendly. Do not embed attachments. One primary CTA link only.)


QUALITY CHECKLIST (verify before sending)
- [ ] Opens with an impact mini‑story and personalization
- [ ] Goal is clear; progress is specific and visual in Emails 2–3
- [ ] Match/countdown details are accurate and prominent
- [ ] One CTA only; button text is clear and linked to [DONATION LINK]
- [ ] Mobile‑friendly: short paragraphs, clear line breaks, scannable
- [ ] Tone matches [TONE]; plain language, Grade 6–8 reading level
- [ ] Includes community proof and forward/share invite
- [ ] Year‑end bridge line included
- [ ] Footer includes tax language, address, unsubscribe
- [ ] No clichés, jargon, guilt, or multiple competing asks

Make it simple, urgent, and specific. Emphasize participation over dollars, clarity over flourish, and authenticity over hype. A small team should be able to copy, customize, and send with confidence.

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 1: MORNING LAUNCH (7–9am MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Inspire a child's love for reading
2. Double your impact, double their smiles

PREHEADER:
Every $25 helps rural kids read. Match available!

EMAIL BODY:
Hi Friend,

Imagine Jayden, a 2nd grader on our Tuesday route, eagerly picking out his next adventure from our bookmobile. Your support makes that moment possible! Today, on GivingTuesday, we’re aiming for 200 donors to ensure more children like Jayden have access to free books and reading clubs for rural kids.

A generous **$5,000 match from Meadowview Credit Union** means your gift goes twice as far to spark a child's imagination, but only until 11:59pm MT tonight! A donation of $25 stocks a child’s book bundle, and with the match, it supports two children. Join us and your neighbors in bringing the joy of reading to rural communities. Your GivingTuesday gift builds crucial momentum for our year-end work, helping us reach even more young readers in the months to come.

Ready to make a difference?

CTA BUTTON: Give Books Now

P.S. Help us reach our goal of 200 donors for rural kids today!

SOCIAL SHARE: Spread the word! Share this email with #GiveReading #RuralKidsRead and tag @PineRidgeBooks.

IMAGE SUGGESTION: A photo of a smiling child (like Jayden) holding a book they just received from the bookmobile. Alt-text: "Jayden, a 2nd grader, happily holding a new book from the Pine Ridge Bookmobile."

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: We're so glad you're learning about our mission to bring books and joy to rural kids today.
• Past donors: Thank you for your past support; let's create even more reading smiles today!

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 2: MID‑DAY UPDATE (12–2pm MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Mid-day update: We're halfway there!
2. Match Alert! Don't miss out - #GiveReading

PREHEADER:
We're making great progress towards 200 donors!

EMAIL BODY:
Hi Friend,

Jayden, that 2nd grader we told you about, is just one of many children whose worlds expand with every book they read. Your support fuels these vital connections. We're thrilled to report that we've already reached **[X] donors** towards our 200-donor goal! That’s incredible momentum, but we still have more to go.

The **$5,000 match from Meadowview Credit Union** is still active, but it ends at 11:59pm MT. Every dollar you give is doubled, meaning your $25 gift, which stocks a child’s book bundle, now provides two bundles!

Here's how your GivingTuesday gift impacts young readers:
• Provides brand-new books to eager hands
• Supports engaging reading clubs and activities
• Helps us reach remote communities with our bookmobile
• Doubles your impact with the Meadowview Credit Union match!

Join the growing number of community members making a difference today. Your gift builds significant momentum for our year-end fundraising goals, ensuring a bright future for literacy.

CTA BUTTON: Donate & Double

P.S. Let's keep the momentum going! Your donation means so much.

SOCIAL SHARE: Help us hit our goal! Share this update with #GiveReading #RuralKidsRead and @PineRidgeBooks.

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: This is your chance to join our community and make a significant first impact.
• Past donors: Your continued generosity helps us thrive; thank you for considering another gift today!

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 3: FINAL PUSH (6–9pm MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Last Chance: Match Ends at 11:59 PM MT!
2. Final push for rural kids – #GiveReading

PREHEADER:
Only hours left to double your gift for young readers!

EMAIL BODY:
Hi Friend,

Jayden and so many other kids rely on the Pine Ridge Bookmobile for their next great read. Tonight is our last chance to secure vital support for free books and reading clubs for rural kids. We’re so close to our goal of 200 donors, with **[Y] donors** already on board! Every single gift right now counts toward reaching our target.

Our incredible **$5,000 match from Meadowview Credit Union** ends in just a few hours at 11:59pm MT! This is your final opportunity to have your donation doubled, meaning $25 stocks a child’s book bundle, and empowers two young readers. We've seen incredible generosity today, showing how much our community values literacy.

Let's finish strong! Add your name to our list of supporters and help us deliver more books and programs. Your GivingTuesday gift is a powerful start to our year-end fundraising, ensuring continued success for our mission. We believe every donor counts.

CTA BUTTON: Give Before 11:59pm

P.S. The Meadowview Credit Union match expires at 11:59pm MT tonight!

SOCIAL SHARE: It's the final hour! Share this with #GiveReading #RuralKidsRead and @PineRidgeBooks.

IMAGE SUGGESTION: A graphic showing a progress bar or thermometer filling up towards "200 Donors", with a "Match Ending Soon!" notification. Alt-text: "GivingTuesday progress bar showing donations nearing the 200 donor goal."

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: There’s no better time than now to invest in a child’s future.
• Past donors: Your continued partnership is creating a lasting legacy—thank you!

═══════════════════════════════════════
STANDARD FOOTER (Use for all three emails)
═══════════════════════════════════════

From: Pine Ridge Bookmobile <hello@pineridgebookmobile.org> • Reply‑To: elena@pineridgebookmobile.org
Pine Ridge Bookmobile is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Donations are tax‑deductible as allowed by law. EIN 86-2198741, Pine Ridge Bookmobile, Inc.
14 Depot Street, Pine Ridge, MT 59741
Manage preferences | Unsubscribe | Privacy: https://www.pineridgebookmobile.org/privacy

(If using Simple HTML, keep styling minimal and mobile‑friendly. Do not embed attachments. One primary CTA link only.)

QUALITY CHECKLIST (verify before sending)
- [x] Opens with an impact mini‑story and personalization
- [x] Goal is clear; progress is specific and visual in Emails 2–3 (Placeholder for [X] and [Y] numbers in output)
- [x] Match/countdown details are accurate and prominent
- [x] One CTA only; button text is clear and linked to https://www.pineridgebookmobile.org/give/givingtuesday
- [x] Mobile‑friendly: short paragraphs, clear line breaks, scannable
- [x] Tone matches WARM; plain language, Grade 6–8 reading level
- [x] Includes community proof and forward/share invite
- [x] Year‑end bridge line included
- [x] Footer includes tax language, address, unsubscribe
- [x] No clichés, jargon, guilt, or multiple competing asks

evaluation.reasoning: This is a highly usable, well-structured campaign that follows the template closely and maintains appropriate warm tone throughout. The emails are actionable and authentic, though they contain placeholder variables that need manual updating and a few minor structural deviations from the prompt requirements.
strengths: Excellent tone consistency - warm, mission-forward language that feels genuine and community-centered without being overly sentimental
Strong use of the Jayden impact story throughout all three emails, creating narrative continuity
Clear, mobile-friendly formatting with short paragraphs and effective use of bold for key numbers and deadlines
Effective urgency building across the three emails without guilt tactics - progresses naturally from launch to final push
Good integration of match details with specific source, amount, and deadline consistently mentioned
Practical CTA button text that's clear and action-oriented
Proper inclusion of all compliance elements in footer
Useful donor segmentation swaps that are genuinely different for new vs. returning donors
weaknesses: Email 2 uses placeholder [X] and Email 3 uses placeholder [Y] for progress numbers instead of providing realistic example numbers (e.g., '127 of 200 donors'), which the prompt specifically requested with examples

Word counts slightly exceed the 150-220 target in some emails (Email 1 appears to be around 140 words in body, Email 2 around 145, Email 3 around 150 - actually these are compliant, but bullets in Email 2 could be tighter)
Subject lines in Email 1 option 2 ('Double your impact, double their smiles') feels slightly less authentic/more marketing-speak than the warm tone suggests
The year-end bridge sentence, while present in all emails, is somewhat formulaic and could be more naturally integrated
Email 2's bulleted list has only 4 bullets when 3-5 were requested, and the bullets could be more specific to impact units or current momentum numbers

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 1: MORNING LAUNCH (7–9am MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Your $25 doubles for kids today
2. GivingTuesday match starts now—join in!

PREHEADER:
Every gift matched by Meadowview Credit Union

EMAIL BODY:
Hi Friend,

Last Tuesday, Jayden, a 2nd grader on our route, chose his very first chapter book. His mom told us he's been reading under the covers every night since. That's the magic **$25** creates—it stocks a child's book bundle that opens up whole new worlds.

Today is **GivingTuesday**, and we're aiming for **200 donors** to step up for rural kids like Jayden. Even better? Thanks to **Meadowview Credit Union**, every gift you make by **11:59pm MT tonight** is **matched dollar-for-dollar** up to **$5,000**—your $25 becomes $50 of books and reading support.

This is the kickoff to our year-end season, not a replacement—your gift today helps us build momentum through December and shows kids across Pine Ridge that their community is rooting for them.

Will you be one of the 200 neighbors who gives today?

With gratitude,

**Elena Lopez**  
Director  
Pine Ridge Bookmobile

CTA BUTTON: Double my gift now

P.S. The **$5,000 match** ends at **11:59pm MT**—don't leave matching funds on the table!

SOCIAL SHARE: Know someone who loves books and kids? Forward this email or share your gift on social with #GiveReading #RuralKidsRead and tag @PineRidgeBooks!

IMAGE SUGGESTION: Photo of a smiling child holding a stack of books inside or beside the bookmobile. Alt-text: "Second grade student holding new chapter books from Pine Ridge Bookmobile"

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: Today's the perfect day to join 200 neighbors making reading possible for rural kids across Pine Ridge.
• Past donors: You've already shown kids like Jayden that you believe in them—will you give again today and see your gift matched?

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 2: MID‑DAY UPDATE (12–2pm MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Halfway there—127 donors and counting!
2. Match update: $2,800 left to unlock

PREHEADER:
Your neighbors are stepping up. Will you join?

EMAIL BODY:
Hi Friend,

**127 of 200 donors** have already given today—we're **64% to our goal!**

Every $25 still doubles thanks to Meadowview Credit Union, and we have **$2,800 left in matching funds** to unlock before **11:59pm MT**.

Here's what's happening right now:

• **78 book bundles** funded so far—kids like Jayden will choose their own stories
• **$2,200 matched**—your gift is worth twice as much until tonight
• **First-time donors are 41% of today's total**—new friends are joining the bookmobile family
• Share this email or post with **#GiveReading** and **@PineRidgeBooks** to spread the word
• Check if your employer matches gifts—it triples your impact!

Your GivingTuesday gift helps us finish the year strong and keeps the bookmobile rolling into 2025.

There's still time to double your impact and be one of the 200.

**Elena Lopez**  
Director

CTA BUTTON: Make my gift count

P.S. Only **73 donors** needed to hit 200—and **$2,800 in match funds** still available!

SOCIAL SHARE: Tag a book lover! Forward this or post your support with #GiveReading #RuralKidsRead and @PineRidgeBooks.

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: Join 127 neighbors who've already given today—it's a great day to start supporting rural kids.
• Past donors: You're part of our bookmobile family—add your name to today's donor roll and double your impact before tonight!

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 3: FINAL PUSH (6–9pm MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Just 31 donors to go—match ends tonight
2. Final hours: your $25 becomes $50

PREHEADER:
11:59pm MT deadline. Match funds still available.

EMAIL BODY:
Hi Friend,

We're **169 of 200 donors**—just **31 people away** from our GivingTuesday goal!

And there's still **$1,450 in match funds** from Meadowview Credit Union waiting to double your gift. But only until **11:59pm MT tonight**.

Jayden got his first chapter book last week because neighbors like you said yes. Tonight, 31 more people can make sure kids across rural Montana keep discovering the joy of choosing their own stories. **$25 stocks a child's book bundle**—and today, it's worth **$50**.

This has been an incredible day. First-time donors, longtime friends, people forwarding this email to their book clubs—**169 neighbors** have shown up. Every single gift counts, and yours can be one of the final 31 that gets us across the finish line.

Your gift today launches our year-end momentum and proves to rural kids that reading matters.

Will you close out GivingTuesday with us?

**Elena Lopez**  
Director  
Pine Ridge Bookmobile

CTA BUTTON: Give by 11:59pm MT

P.S. **31 donors. $1,450 match left. 11:59pm MT tonight.** Let's finish strong together!

SOCIAL SHARE: Know 31 people who love kids and books? Forward this now or share your gift with #GiveReading #RuralKidsRead and @PineRidgeBooks—every share helps!

IMAGE SUGGESTION: Graphic showing "169 of 200 donors" with progress bar or illustrated bookmobile with donor count. Alt-text: "GivingTuesday progress: 169 of 200 donors reached for Pine Ridge Bookmobile"

DONOR SEGMENT SWAP:
• New donors: Be one of the final 31 donors to join our GivingTuesday community—it's a perfect night to start!
• Past donors: You've given before, and it's made all the difference—will you be one of the last 31 donors to help us reach 200 tonight?

═══════════════════════════════════════
STANDARD FOOTER (Use for all three emails)
═══════════════════════════════════════

From: Pine Ridge Bookmobile <hello@pineridgebookmobile.org> • Reply‑To: elena@pineridgebookmobile.org

Pine Ridge Bookmobile is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Donations are tax‑deductible as allowed by law. EIN 86-2198741, Pine Ridge Bookmobile, Inc.

14 Depot Street, Pine Ridge, MT 59741

Manage preferences | Unsubscribe | Privacy: https://www.pineridgebookmobile.org/privacy

---

**QUALITY CHECKLIST**

- [x] Opens with an impact mini‑story and personalization
- [x] Goal is clear; progress is specific and visual in Emails 2–3
- [x] Match/countdown details are accurate and prominent
- [x] One CTA only; button text is clear and linked to donation page
- [x] Mobile‑friendly: short paragraphs, clear line breaks, scannable
- [x] Tone matches WARM; plain language, Grade 6–8 reading level
- [x] Includes community proof and forward/share invite
- [x] Year‑end bridge line included
- [x] Footer includes tax language, address, unsubscribe
- [x] No clichés, jargon, guilt, or multiple competing asks

evaluation.reasoning: This is an exceptionally well-executed campaign that demonstrates deep understanding of nonprofit fundraising best practices. The warm tone is perfectly calibrated for a small rural organization, the progression across three emails creates genuine urgency without manipulation, and the specific details (Jayden's story, exact match amounts, realistic progress numbers) make it feel authentic and actionable.
strengths: Perfect tone execution - warm, community-centered, and authentic to a small rural nonprofit without being saccharine or overly casual
Excellent progression and math - the donor counts (127→169) and match depletion ($2,200→$3,550 used of $5,000) are realistic and create credible momentum
Strong impact storytelling - Jayden reading under the covers is specific, visual, and emotionally resonant without being manipulative
Outstanding mobile optimization - short paragraphs, strategic bold formatting on key numbers, highly scannable structure
Smart segmentation swaps that genuinely differentiate messaging for new vs. returning donors
Effective year-end bridge language in each email without distracting from the primary ask
Subject lines are concrete and benefit-focused rather than generic ('Your $25 doubles' vs 'It's GivingTuesday!')
Bulleted list in Email 2 provides genuine value and variety (impact, match status, participation options, social proof)
CTAs are clear, varied, and action-oriented ('Double my gift now', 'Make my gift count', 'Give by 11:59pm MT')
Social share language feels natural and includes specific hashtags/handles as requested
weaknesses: Email 2 body is approximately 185 words with bullets, which is within range but on the higher end - could be tightened slightly for faster mobile scanning
The phrase 'don't leave matching funds on the table' in Email 1 P.S. is slightly clichéd, though not egregious
Minor: The image suggestions are good but could be slightly more specific about composition (e.g., 'close-up of child's hands holding books' vs. just 'child holding books')

═══════════════════════════════════════
EMAIL 1: MORNING LAUNCH (7–9am MT)
═══════════════════════════════════════

SUBJECT LINE OPTIONS:
1. Kickstart GivingTuesday for Rural Readers
2. Double your impact for young readers

PREHEADER:
Gifts doubled by Meadowview Credit Union until 11:59pm.
